data.stimulus:
Let's start by summarising what you learned about academic reports so far.

► Choose a word of phrase from the drop down to complete the paragraph.
   

(there is one extra option that you don't need)
data.template:
A report is written for a clear {{response}} and to a particular {{response}}. It discusses a topic in {{response}} format. The {{response}} is presented in a clearly structured format using {{response}}​​​​ so that the information is easy to locate and follow.
Reports can be academic, technical, or business-oriented, and feature {{response}}​​​​​​ for specific actions. Reports are written to present {{response}} about a situation, project, or process and will examine the issue at hand in a {{response}} way.

value: This kind of report presents and evaluates the positive and/or negative features of a product, place, plan, etc. They also include a recommendation.
This kind of report presents plans, decisions or suggestions concerning possible future courses of action for approval by a superior at work, a bank manager, members of a committee, etc.
This kind of report which contains the information regarding the overall market situation of a product or service.
This kind of report presents and analyses information gathered from primary research (surveys/questionnaires), including conclusions drawn from this information and suggestions or recommendations.
This kind of report presents information concerning a business idea or project. These reports include an assessment of the idea, primary and secondary research and a proposed course of action.

possible_responses: This kind of report presents information concerning a business idea or project. These reports include an assessment of the idea, primary and secondary research and a proposed course of action.
This kind of report which contains the information regarding the overall market situation of a product or service.
This kind of report presents and analyses information gathered from primary research (surveys/questionnaires), including conclusions drawn from this information and suggestions or recommendations.
This kind of report presents and evaluates the positive and/or negative features of a product, place, plan, etc. They also include a recommendation.
This kind of report presents plans, decisions or suggestions concerning possible future courses of action for approval by a superior at work, a bank manager, members of a committee, etc.
data.stimulus:
During the PSE, you will work on different kinds of reports.

► Match the type of report to the correct description.

value: This kind of report presents and evaluates the positive and/or negative features of a product, place, plan, etc. They also include a recommendation.
This kind of report presents plans, decisions or suggestions concerning possible future courses of action for approval by a superior at work, a bank manager, members of a committee, etc.
This kind of report which contains the information regarding the overall market situation of a product or service.
This kind of report presents and analyses information gathered from primary research (surveys/questionnaires), including conclusions drawn from this information and suggestions or recommendations.
This kind of report presents information concerning a business idea or project. These reports include an assessment of the idea, primary and secondary research and a proposed course of action.

options.label: To describe the restaurant's food, service, prices and atmosphere.
To suggest ways it can be more suitable for tourists on a tight budget.
To find out if this restaurant is suitable for tourists on a tight budget.

data.stimulus:
In the next part of the lesson, you are going to analyse an example report. 

► This will help understand how to write your own report.

 

 

Let's start with the first step: analysing the brief.
►  Read it carefully and answer the questions below.

 

1. What is the aim / purpose of the report?

► Read the brief carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

2. Who is your audience (who is going tor read your report)? 

► Read the brief carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

options.label: A proposal report - to present plans, decisions or suggestions for a future course of action.
A market report - to present the overall market situation
An assessment report - to evaluate the positive and/or negative features

data.stimulus:
3. What kind of report should you write? 

► Read the brief carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

Assessment Reports - Useful Language

 

 

When evaluating positive and/or negative features, you need to use linking words to connect your ideas. 

► You can find several in the  example report  below.

 

► Read it carefully and choose the correct linking word from he drop down.
data.template:
Section 1 

The aim of this report to assess the suitability of Seaside Restaurant for tourists on a tight budget. 

Section 2

Seaside Restaurant serves good quality meals. It has a wide variety of delicious local and international dishes {{response}}  an excellent choice of starters. The menu {{response}} includes a number of French specialties. The only disappointing feature is the dessert menu, as there are only two choices. 

Section 3

{{response}} the fact that the staff at Seaside Restaurant are well-trained and polite, the service can sometimes be slow. This can be a problem when the restaurant is full. 

Section 4

The prices are quite reasonable. {{response}}, some dishes, such as the French specialities, are rather expensive. 

Section 5

Seaside has a charming and relaxing atmosphere. The background music is pleasant {{response}} the soft lighting creates a cosy atmosphere. These elements, combined with the modem decor, appeal to customers of all ages. 

Section 6

{{response}} the service can sometimes be slow, Seaside offers first-class food at reasonable prices. 
{{response}}, I highly recommend this restaurant for tourists on a tight budget.

possible_responses: Introduction of the Report about Seaside Restaurant
Decor, Music, Lighting and Other Elements
data.stimulus:
Section headings are a very important part of the report. 

► Good section headings should be CLEAR, SHORT and CONCISE.

 

 

The section headings are missing from the report below. 

► Choose the best headings from the drop down.
data.template:
{{response}}

The aim of this report to assess the suitability of Seaside Restaurant for tourists on a tight budget. 

{{response}}

Seaside serves good quality meals. It has a wide variety of delicious local and international dishes as well as an excellent choice of starters. The menu also includes a number of French specialties. The only disappointing feature is the dessert menu, as there are only two choices. 

{{response}}

Despite the fact that the staff at Seaside Restaurant are well-trained and polite, the service can sometimes be slow. This can be a problem when the restaurant is full. 

{{response}}

The prices are quite reasonable. However, some dishes, such as the French specialities, are rather expensive. 

{{response}}

Seaside has a charming and relaxing atmosphere. The background music is pleasant and the soft lighting creates a cosy atmosphere. These elements, combined with the modem decor, appeal to customers of all ages. 

{{response}}

Even though the service can sometimes be slow, Seaside offers first-class food at reasonable prices. Therefore, I highly recommend this restaurant for tourists on a tight budget.

options.label: Despite read ten books a year, Philipe doesn't like reading.
Despite reading ten books a year, Philipe doesn't like reading.
Despite he reads ten books a year, Philipe doesn't like reading.

data.stimulus:
► Now choose the sentence that uses the linker correctly.

 

1. Philipe reads ten books a year. He doesn't like reading. (despite)

data.template: 2. {{response}} many international student speak English quite well, some have difficulties with their writing.

options.label: Though it did not help my research, it was a good website.
Though it was a good website, it did not help my research.
Though it was a good website. It did not help my research.

data.template: 4. {{response}} the hard work, I really enjoyed my course.
5. {{response}} having a lecture early in the morning, Selma studied all night.

data.stimulus:
Although you are now an expert in contrast linkers, it's always good to learn more! 

 

Watch the second part of the BBC video lesson and answer the questions.

► BBC Video Lesson Part 2
data.template:
1. {{response}} the university was closed in 2020, students could continue to attend their lessons online. 
2. {{response}} most students enjoyed studying online, they probably missed communicating with classmates face to face. 
3. {{response}}  being on holiday, she studied English everyday. 
4. Thousands of international students complete UK degrees every year, {{response}} English is not their first language. 
5. {{response}} the weather, they had a great time in London.

stems: Long sentences with more than 40 words
Linking words and phrases such as and, but, so
Linking words and phrases such as in addition, although, therefore
data.stimulus:
As we mentioned in the beginning of the lesson, academic writing should be formal.

► Let's consider some characteristics of formal writing. 

 

In formal / academic writing style, we use...

value: The aim of this report is

possible_responses: The aim of this report is
data.stimulus:
In the mini-report below, the writer used several informal expressions, which are not suitable for an academic report.

► Replace them with the more formal expressions below.

 

 
Introduction
I've written this report to recommend ways to get more students to shop at Riverside Mall.
Positive and negative points
Riverside Mall is one of the most convenient centres in our city. What I mean is, it is located near the main bus terminal and so it is easily accessible to students. Also, there are lots of restaurants where shoppers can eat lunch or dinner. Finally, there are nice facilities for people with special needs. But the problem is most shops are old fashioned and super expensive.
Conclusion and recommendation
To sum up, Riverside Mall would bring in more students if it had more trendy shops selling cheaper products.
data.template:
Informal Expressions ⇒ Formal Expressions

  • I've written this report ⇒ {{response}}
  • get ⇒ {{response}}
  • What I mean is ⇒ {{response}}
  • so ⇒ {{response}}
  • Also ⇒ {{response}}
  • lots of ⇒ {{response}}
  • nice ⇒ {{response}}
  • But the problem is ⇒ {{response}}
  • super ⇒ {{response}}
  • trendy ⇒ {{response}}
  • cheaper ⇒ {{response}}

value: The aim of this report is
